casebody.data:
SOCIÉTÉ ANONYME DES SUCRERIES DE SAINT JEAN v. MIGUEL CHIQUES BERLINGERY. San Juan,

Equity,

No. 1019. On Motion to Stbike Testimony. [Practice — Party as Witness. The statements made by a party as a witness do not amount to . an admission as a party to the case. Opinion filed April 2, 1919. *239Mr. H. O. Molina for plaintiff. Mr. E. H. F. Dottin for defendant. HaMIltóN, Judge,

delivered the following opinion:

The motion to strike is granted. . When the plaintiff gets on the stand he is not the plaintiff. He is simply a witness. What he says on the stand is not an admission. It is a very interesting distinction but I think a correct one. Admission by a party is before he gets into court, and not afterwards.
